alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 27 at 6:17PM PST until further notice by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Rain is ongoing over Mason County and may be heavy at times throughout the overnight hours. This is expected to bring the river levels up as a result.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. WAC045-280830- /O.CON.KSEW.FL.W.0074.000000T0000Z-000000T0000Z/ /SRPW1.3.ER.221224T2018Z.221228T0115Z.000000T0000Z.NR/ 617 PM PST Tue Dec 27 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. The river is now at 17.95 feet and rising where major flooding is 18 feet. Major flooding is possible through the overnight hours before the river declines back to moderate flood stage. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 17.95 feet, the Skokomish River will cause moderate to possibly major flooding, with deep and quick flood waters inundating some residential areas, many roads, and much of the farm land in the Skokomish Valley. Inundated roads include the Skokomish Valley road, Bourgault Road West, Purdy Cutoff Road, and Highway 106. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 17.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:45 PM PST Tuesday was 17.95 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 17.8 feet. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.8 feet on 03/19/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
